alert.note: Alert for Cascade Foothills in Lane County; Cascades in Lane County; Central Coast Range of Western Oregon; Central Oregon Coast; Central Willamette Valley; Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Greater Portland Metro Area; North Oregon Coast; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills; Northern Oregon Cascades; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 7:12PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...BURST OF GUSTY SOUTHWEST WINDS TONIGHT... Low pressure will continue to rapidly develop this evening and is expected to move onshore along the north Oregon coast by 10 PM Tuesday night. Latest models show this system strengthening as it moves on shore and pushes inland across northwest Oregon. Therefore a brief period of gusty southwest winds is expected along a line from Tillamook to Oregon City and southward. Southwest wind gusts will approach 40 to 50 mph for the coastal communities, with gusts up to 60 mph possible for the beaches, headlands and nearby coastal ridges. Southerly winds are also expected to increase this evening through the central and southern Willamette Valley, as well as across the Cascade foothills, where gusts are expected to approach 40 to 50 mph. Winds will likely shift westerly behind the system. Strongest winds will most likely occur between 8 PM and Midnight. The period of strongest winds will only last a few hours and will likely settle after midnight. Isolated power outages will be possible due to the gusty winds this evening.
